creator: jim@netyourwork.com
text:
It appears that dy attributes are handled incorrectly within <tspan> elements.

My reading of the SVG 1.0 Rec is that the SVG below should result in four lines 
of text, rendered one right after the other.  Instead, the 3rd and 4th lines 
are rendered on top of the second line.  If I change the dy attr of the 3rd and 
4th lines to "30" and "45" respectively, I get four lines of text rendered one 
right after the other.

The example below does display correctly in Adobe's SVG viewer 3.0 beta 1 build 
42.  If I change the dy's to 30/45 as above, the lines are rendered 
progressively farther apart, which I believe is correct behavior.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.0//EN"
  "http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/PR-SVG-20010719/DTD/svg10.dtd">
<svg height="500" width="1000" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect class="classRect" height="60" style="fill:white;stroke:black;" 
width="100" x="150" 
        y="250"/>
  <text class="className" startOffset="0" 
        style="color:black;font-family:Serif;font-size:12;" x="155"  
        y="262">wwwwwwww<tspan fill="red" x="155" 
dy="15">MMMMMMMM</tspan><tspan fill="red" x="155" 
dy="15">mmmmmmmm</tspan><tspan fill="red" x="155" 
dy="15">WWWWWWWW</tspan></text>
</svg>
